javadbexpert
Class ResultSetTableModel

java.lang.Object
  javadbexpert.ResultSetTableModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.swing.table.TableModel
public class ResultSetTableModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.table.TableModel

This class takes a JDBC ResultSet object and implements the TableModel interface in terms of it so that a Swing JTable component can display the contents of the ResultSet. Note that it requires a scrollable JDBC 2.0 ResultSet. Also note that it provides read-only access to the results

close

public void close()
Call this when done with the table model. It closes the ResultSet and the Statement object used to create it.

getValueAt

public java.lang.Object getValueAt(int row,
                                   int column)
This is the key method of TableModel: it returns the value at each cell of the table. We use strings in this case. If anything goes wrong, we return the exception as a string, so it will be displayed in the table. Note that SQL row and column numbers start at 1, but TableModel column numbers start at 0.

Specified by:
getValueAt in interface javax.swing.table.TableModel
